{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has a 6-month history of shoulder pain and an acute exacerbation after a basketball game. The patient's symptoms are consistent with supraspinatus injury. Supraspinatus is the most frequently injured musculotendinous structure of the shoulder, which is responsible for initiating abduction and external rotation of the shoulder. Therefore, we would expect initiation of abduction to be deficient on physical exam.", "answer_choice": C}
